name: Savory Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove seeds. In a saucepan, combine quinoa and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until quinoa is cooked. In a large bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Stuff the peppers with the mixture. Bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender. Serve hot.

name: Lemon Garlic Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and oregano. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sear chicken on both sides until golden brown. Transfer chicken to a baking dish. In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic until fragrant. Add lemon juice and bring to a simmer. Pour the lemon-garlic mixture over the chicken. Bake for 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

name: Mango Avocado Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine diced mangoes, avocados, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and cilantro. In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss to coat. Serve immediately as a refreshing side dish or light lunch.
